y Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA)
The key concepts in Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY release prevention program are employee participation, appropriate design and maintenance of equipment, and appropriate training of all employees. Tyson Processing Services, INC has developed and documented these elements in their process safety management plan (PSM). The PSM plan is incorporated with this document by reference.
Key personnel are responsible for conducting and implementing the findings from the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for the ammonia systems. Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY utilizes a combination of outside sources and facility employees for emergency response and coordinates with responders on an annual basis. Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY policy is to construct all new equipment, systems, and facilities to ensure the appropriate safety and release prevention systems are included from the beginning of each project. Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY maintains a computerized program of maintenance activities to ensure that key systems are maintained appropriately to minimize the risk of a release. Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY is committed to providing appropriate training to all employees.
Regarding safety procedures, each new employee is provided comprehensive safety training during their initial orientation for the facility.
Tyson Processing Services, INC. Bowling Green, KY conducts regularly scheduled safety training for all employees each year. Additional training is provided to maintenance personnel for the systems they are responsible for; this includes PPE training.
4. Five-year accident history. No reportable accident in the last five years.
5. The emergency response program. A written Emergency Response Plan has been developed and is on record at the Facility.
6. Planned changes to improve safety: This facility will continually inspect, and upgrade equipment as required.

EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
TYSON PROCESSING SERVICES, INC. Bowling Green, KY
1. Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy
It is the policy of the Tyson Processing Services, INC. Bowling Green, KY facility management to implement the requirements of this Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40CFR Part 68 and with the corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM)program. The objective
is to minimize the risk of a release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to Tyson Processing Services, INC. Bowling Green, KY employees, the public and the environment. This objective will be accomplished by utilizing generally accepted good operating procedures, providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local emergency response providers. This plan covers all Tyson Processing Services, INC. Bowling Green, KY owned activities at this facility. Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy.
2. Facility Description
Tyson Processing Services, INC Bowling Green, KY is a food processing facility that uses anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant throughout the facility.
3. The general accidental release prevention program.
Tyson Processing Services, INC. Bowling Green, KY facility is governed by a set of OSHA and USEPA regulations that require planning and facility activities intended to prevent a release of hazardous material, or if a release inadvertently occurs, to minimize the consequences of a release to the employees of the facility, the public and to the environment. These regulations include:
40 CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention
40 CFR Part 112, Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure
29 CFR Part 119, Process Safety Management
40 CFR Part 302, Emergency Planning and Communit
